notes:
Cecily Farnes-Barnes



March 13


Dearest Lonslo,


From the Western Union office in Shyster Street, please send a copy of the
Western Union MTCN number etc
to Mr Havens. The amount is £610.50 . This original slip was sent
last week to his Citibank colleague 
Mrs Adams.


Many thanks for your kind assistance in keeping the custard boiling,


Much love,
Cecily Farnes-Barnes

from the desk of Sir Charles Farnes-Barnes VC


My Dear Lonslo,
I cannot thank you enough for your time and trouble in stretching out these modalities.


A large Smegaroon Special will be waiting for you at the bar when my lady wife and I
have the pleasure of dining with you and Mrs Tossov at the Ritz tomorrow night.


Kindest regards,


Charles

messages.subject: FUND RELEASE ADVICE (US$10.3M)
messages.body:
CITIBANK LONDON
25 Canada Square Canary Wharf
London E14 5LB United Kingdom
=============================


To: Charles Farnes Barnes 


Fund release valued $10,300,000.00


Dear beneficiary,


I am in receipt of your email, this is  to inform you that we have received an introduction/instruction from the office of Mr. Philip Mulligan Executive Director United Nations Organization to attend to you regarding the processing and release of your grant winning award benefit valued US$10,300,000.00(Ten million, three hundred United States Dollars only) via our bank telegraphic wire transfer services. 



This fund was awarded to you in form of grant by the United Nations, World Bank Group and European Union as the beneficiary of the first quota of the 2012 global fund support and International partnership as a mean of combating the looming global financial crisis and is 100% legitimate. We the Citibank of London is the official remitting financial institution (bank) to handle and process the release of your US$10.3Million to any of your nominated bank account in the world. All necessary documentations and instructions have been furnished to us in that regard to attend to you as the Beneficiary in the release of your fund entitlement. Find attach copy of my staff ID. 


For a smooth transfer of your fund, you are advise to reconfirm the the follow information to us.


YOUR FULL NAME:
FULL CONTACT ADDRESS:
CITY/STATE/COUNTRY VERY IMPORTANT:
PHONE  AND MOBILE VERY IMPORTANT: 
BANK NAMES:
ACCOUNT NO,
ROUTING NO:
SWIFT CODE 
BANK ADDRESS: 
AGE:
MARITAL STATUS:
OCCUPATION:
COPY OF YOUR INT'L PASSPORT/DRIVERS LICENSE


Make sure that the required information  reach us within the next 24 business hours so that we can start processing your transfer.


Call me if there is anything you do not understand.


I look forward hearing from you.


Yours faithfully


Mr. John Havens
Position (Head of Foreign Operations)
Citibank, 25 Canada Square Canary Wharf,
London E14 5LB United Kingdom.
Tel: +44-770-007-4864
foreignoperation@citimail.co.cc
         OR
citbnk04@blumail.org
messages.raw:
John Havens

Out of the blue comes a 'grant', which our hero never applied for. This is a variation on the 'you've won a lottery you never entered' format.

From: foreignoperation@citimail.co.cc
To: Charles Farnes-Barnes
Subject: FUND RELEASE ADVICE (US$10.3M)
Date: Fri, 24 Feb 2012 15:40:42 +0000

CITIBANK LONDON
25 Canada Square Canary Wharf
London E14 5LB United Kingdom
=============================

To: Charles Farnes Barnes

Fund release valued $10,300,000.00

Dear beneficiary,

I am in receipt of your email, this is to inform you that we have received an introduction/instruction from the office of Mr. Philip Mulligan Executive Director United Nations Organization to attend to you regarding the processing and release of your grant winning award benefit valued US$10,300,000.00(Ten million, three hundred United States Dollars only) via our bank telegraphic wire transfer services.

"I am in receipt of your email" - There was no previous mail. Many scam mails lead off with this. Even if the puzzled recipient replies "I never wrote to you", the scammer now knows it's a working email address and will keep at it.

This fund was awarded to you in form of grant by the United Nations, World Bank Group and European Union as the beneficiary of the first quota of the 2012 global fund support and International partnership as a mean of combating the looming global financial crisis and is 100% legitimate. We the Citibank of London is the official remitting financial institution (bank) to handle and process the release of your US$10.3Million to any of your nominated bank account in the world. All necessary documentations and instructions have been furnished to us in that regard to attend to you as the Beneficiary in the release of your fund entitlement. Find attach copy of my staff ID.

For a smooth transfer of your fund, you are advise to reconfirm the the follow information to us.

YOUR FULL NAME:
FULL CONTACT ADDRESS:
CITY/STATE/COUNTRY VERY IMPORTANT:
PHONE AND MOBILE VERY IMPORTANT:
BANK NAMES:
ACCOUNT NO,
ROUTING NO:
SWIFT CODE
BANK ADDRESS:
AGE:
MARITAL STATUS:
OCCUPATION:
COPY OF YOUR INT'L PASSPORT/DRIVERS LICENSE

Make sure that the required information reach us within the next 24 business hours so that we can start processing your transfer.

Call me if there is anything you do not understand.

I look forward hearing from you.

Yours faithfully

Mr. John Havens
Position (Head of Foreign Operations)
Citibank, 25 Canada Square Canary Wharf,
London E14 5LB United Kingdom.
Tel: +44-770-007-4864
foreignoperation@citimail.co.cc
OR
citbnk04@blumail.org

This, and all emails from "Havens", included a 'borrowed' Citibank logo stored on someone's blog:
http://{name removed}/wp-content/uploads/2009/06/citibank-logo.jpg
It's since been removed so looks like they fixed their permissions.

messages.subject: US$10.3M FUND WIRE TRANSFER
messages.body:
Transfer fund valued $10,300,000.00


Dear beneficiary,


Reference to the fund release valued  USD10, 300,000.00 (Ten million, three hundred thousand  United States Dollars) payment order issued by the United Nations Organization and the European Union in your favour, this is to inform you that we have initiated the transfer of your fund to your designated bank account no: 48179001,with Kreplach Brothers Merchant Bank International PLC,Tossov Towers, 666 Soyton Street London EC4P FU2.The transferred fund is expected to hit your bank account within the next 48hours upon the payment of our transfer handling charge of US$975. Find attached copy of the telex transfer slip, remittance advice and other related clearance documents.


As a matter of fact, your fund have left our bank and is now in the custody of the Federal Reserve Bank of New York which is our monitory correspondent body for accreditation and final authorization to enable the initiated transferred fund arrive your bank account on schedule.


You are highly advised to get in touch with the officer in charge of fund accreditation/authorization in Federal Reserve Bank of New York so that your fund will not be delayed to arrive your bank account. Below is the name and other details of the contact person (officer in charge) in Federal Reserve Bank of New York United States.


Officer: 
Tell: +1-914-265-5495
Email: reservebank.nyc@skymail.mn 


Make sure you send to him copy of the fund transfer slip to him email (reservebank.nyc@skymail.mn) to enable him to his job. Endeavor to get in touch with us as soon as you contacted him.


For the settlement of our transfer handling charge, you are advised to make the payment by western union or money gram to the name of our receiving officer stated below


Receiver: 
Address: 25 Canada Square Canary Wharf,
London E14 5LB United Kingdom
Amount: US$975


Send me copy of the western union payment slip or MTCN and other payment details as an evidence of payment. Bear in mind that settlement of the fee within the stipulated time frame (transfer validity time) is very imperative to avoid further implementation.Therefore, you are advised to apply urgency in this subject matter.



Congratulations!


Yours faithfully


Mr. John Havens
Position (Head of Foreign Operations)
Citibank, 25 Canada Square Canary Wharf,
London E14 5LB United Kingdom.
Tel: +44-770-007-4864
Email: foreignoperation@citimail.co.cc

You are highly advised to get in touch with the officer in charge of fund accreditation/authorization in Federal Reserve Bank of New York so that your fund will not be delayed to arrive your bank account. Below is the name and other details of the contact person (officer in charge) in Federal Reserve Bank of New York United States.

Officer: William C. Dudley
Tell: +1-914-265-5495

Scam-o-note 1: "within the stipulated time frame" -- that's supposed to be psychological pressure.

messages.subject: RE: US$10.3M FUND PAYMENT UPDATE feb 29
messages.body:
Dear Mr Havens,


With regard to your e-mail, you state that I need to pay US$975 which you state is 
equivalent to £613.00.


However, according to my calculations, using the current exchange rate the sum involved should 
only be £610.50.


Would this slightly lower amount be acceptable?


Yours sincerely,
Charles Farnes-Barnes

messages.body:
Dear Mr Havens,


I have only just returned home because the dinner after the Annual General Meeting of the Smegaroon Cricket Club
went on till the wee small hours.


And I must confess that I am suffering from a shocking hangover after downing a raft of pina coladas during the
rather boring speeches. So I shall stay in bed this morning until I have completely recovered.


However, I have my sturdy laptop and so to business - it is surely pointless paying western union to send
money to Mrs Adams. I can send her a cheque on my personal current accountwhich costs nothing -
or I can pop over to Canary Wharf myself on Monday morning and give her the cheque or indeed the cash.


Yours sincerely,
Charles Farnes-Barnes
messages.raw:
Sir Charles Farnes-Barnes

Date: March 2, 2012 2:55:04 AM PST
To: foreignoperation@citimail.co.cc

Dear Mr Havens,

I have only just returned home because the dinner after the Annual General Meeting of the Smegaroon Cricket Club went on till the wee small hours.

And I must confess that I am suffering from a shocking hangover after downing a raft of pina coladas during the rather boring speeches. So I shall stay in bed this morning until I have completely recovered.

However, I have my sturdy laptop and so to business - it is surely pointless paying western union to send money to Mrs Adams. I can send her a cheque on my personal current accountwhich costs nothing - or I can pop over to Canary Wharf myself on Monday morning and give her the cheque or indeed the cash.

Yours sincerely,
Charles Farnes-Barnes

messages.subject: PLEASE READ WITH CARE AND VIEW THE TWO ATTACHMENT ALSO (VERY IMPORTANT)
messages.body:
Transfer fund valued $10,300,000.00


Dear beneficiary,


How are today? I regret to inform you that it seem that Mr. Lonslo Tossov ( the western union officer) is up to something. I strongly believe he is playing some kind of trick on you and myself. In the first place, you told me that you gave him the money to send on Tuesday last week been 6th of March, but from what I saw on the two different slips he sent to me, the transaction took place on 9th been Friday. So what on earth will he be doing with the money three day after you must have giving him to send. 


Anyway, that is not the point am trying to make here. I have attached the two diferent western union slip he sent me for you to view so that you can understand very well the point I want to make here. The first slip Mr. Lonslo Tossov sent to me, the ten (10) digit MONEY TRANSFER CONTROL NUMBER (MTCN) was covered with a small white receipt which is the number needed to confirm the payment. I reported to you that he covered the MTCN and I also wrote him that he covered the MTCN which is important. I went further requesting from him that he should remove the white paper and send to me again. I also made it clear to him that he should type the MTCN number, include it on the email he will send me with new scanned copy of the western union slip.


Surprisingly, yesterday he sent me another scanned western union slip. He removed the small white receipt and cut off four (4) digit numbers out of the ten (10) digit MTCN numbers before sending to me. Now what am I going to do with MTCN that is not complete? Mr. Lonslo Tossov know too well that without the complete Ten digit MTCN, such payment cannot be confirm.


Mr/Mrs Charles Fortescue Farnes-Barnes, I took my time to explain all this so that you will understand that I am not the one delaying your transaction, rather the cause is Mr. Lonslo Tossov the western union officer.


I want to make it clear to you now, as we don't have much time to wast anymore, I demand that you ( Mr/Mrs Charles Fortescue Farnes-Barnes) go to the western union office, tell Mr. Lonslo Tossov to give you the western union slip. Before you go home with the western union slip, ask him what is the status of the transaction? to know if the fund is available to pick up or not because I don't trust him anymore. Tell him to show you the ten (10) digit MTCN number so that when you get back home, you write it out and send to me in case if you don't have scanner.


If you really want us to move forward, just go to the western union and do what I asked you to do. It will only take some of your time and everything will be concluded once and for all.


I look forward hearing from you.


Yours faithfully


Mr. John Havens
Position (Head of Foreign Operations)
Citibank

How are today? I regret to inform you that it seem that Mr. Lonslo Tossov ( the western union officer) is up to something. I strongly believe he is playing some kind of trick on you and myself. In the first place, you told me that you gave him the money to send on Tuesday last week been 6th of March, but from what I saw on the two different slips he sent to me, the transaction took place on 9th been Friday. So what on earth will he be doing with the money three day after you must have giving him to send.

Anyway, that is not the point am trying to make here. I have attached the two diferent western union slip he sent me for you to view so that you can understand very well the point I want to make here. The first slip Mr. Lonslo Tossov sent to me, the ten (10) digit MONEY TRANSFER CONTROL NUMBER (MTCN) was covered with a small white receipt which is the number needed to confirm the payment. I reported to you that he covered the MTCN and I also wrote him that he covered the MTCN which is important. I went further requesting from him that he should remove the white paper and send to me again. I also made it clear to him that he should type the MTCN number, include it on the email he will send me with new scanned copy of the western union slip.

Surprisingly, yesterday he sent me another scanned western union slip. He removed the small white receipt and cut off four (4) digit numbers out of the ten (10) digit MTCN numbers before sending to me. Now what am I going to do with MTCN that is not complete? Mr. Lonslo Tossov know too well that without the complete Ten digit MTCN, such payment cannot be confirm.

Mr/Mrs Charles Fortescue Farnes-Barnes, I took my time to explain all this so that you will understand that I am not the one delaying your transaction, rather the cause is Mr. Lonslo Tossov the western union officer.

I want to make it clear to you now, as we don't have much time to wast anymore, I demand that you ( Mr/Mrs Charles Fortescue Farnes-Barnes) go to the western union office, tell Mr. Lonslo Tossov to give you the western union slip. Before you go home with the western union slip, ask him what is the status of the transaction? to know if the fund is available to pick up or not because I don't trust him anymore. Tell him to show you the ten (10) digit MTCN number so that when you get back home, you write it out and send to me in case if you don't have scanner.

If you really want us to move forward, just go to the western union and do what I asked you to do. It will only take some of your time and everything will be concluded once and for all.

I look forward hearing from you.

Yours faithfully

Mr. John Havens
Position (Head of Foreign Operations)
Citibank

messages.subject: CHECK OUT WHAT MR. TOSSOV SENT ME YESTERDAY
messages.body:
To: Mr/Mrs Charles Fortescue Farnes-Barnes


Transfer fund valued $10,300,000.00


Dear beneficiary,


How are you sir?


Formally, I have decided not to write you regarding this payment. But due to another western union slip MR. TOSSOV sent to me yesterday, then I think you let you know what is going on. Like I said before, I strongly believed that Mr. Tossov is playing on our intelligent.


Remember you told me that you called Mr. Tossov and he assure you that he has canceled the old western union and will send fresh one with a compensation of 50pounds which I rejected the offer. Yesterday, Mr. Tossov send to me email the same old western union slip. Is the old western union slip that bears the same date 9th March the fresh one? Not just that, he now wrote in red with a yellow colored background PAYOUT RESTRICTION TO A PARTICULAR western union AGENT  STATED BELOW. My question is why is it that it is only on the third western union slip that this payout restriction appeared? Why is it not on the first and second once he sent last week? It any of these slips in any way related to the fresh western union slip you talked about?


Listen Mr. Charles, if you know that you are not in any way connected to this, I will advise you to go to Mr. Tossov office and demand for your money 610pounds back. When you get the money back, go to a different western union outlet and send the money yourself to the name of Mrs. Cyrina Adams. After you send the money, send me email the MTCN details or scan copy of the western union slip and send the me.


NOTE: DO NOT LISTEN TO ANY THING MR. TOSSOV WILL SAY. JUST TELL HIM TO GIVE YOUR MONEY BACK THAT YOUR NO LONGER INTERESTED ON HIS SERVICES. BELIEVE ME HE WANT TO POCKET THAT MONEY FOR HIS OWN USE.


Get the MTCN or the western union slip from him and that is final.


Yours faithful


Mr. John Havens

Cc: 	Lonslo Tossov


HAVENS,


I haven't heard from you for a few days so perhaps you realise the game is up. You are very foolish boy and your
amateur attempt at scamming simply caused much laughter. Think about it, you silly fellow - only an idiot would
believe that an respected organisation would be dishing out money via e-mails. And is it likely that an
international bank would only accept payment via western union?


My colleagues from the International Anti-Scam Agency have traced your e-mail and Colonel Tossov of INTERPOL
will soon be knocking at your door. And we also know who your oga is and he will also be hearing from INTERPOL.


Charles Farnes-Barnes 
West Africa Division 
The International Anti-Scam Agency
